meanings.definition: A group of alkaloids found in plants of the nightshade family, used as a sedative and to treat motion sickness.
meanings.sent1: The hyoscines in the plant help people feel calm and relaxed.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes prescribe hyoscines to patients who get sick during travel.
meanings.sent3: The hyoscines in the nightshade plant must be the reason why it sleeps all day!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden where hyoscines bloomed, soothing her worries.
meanings.sent5: The hyoscines danced in her dreams, easing her into a peaceful slumber.

meanings.definition: The plural form of hyoscine, a medication used to prevent nausea and vomiting.
meanings.sent1: After the surgery, the nurse administered hyoscines to prevent any sickness.
meanings.sent2: Pharmacists often stock hyoscines to help patients with stomach troubles.
meanings.sent3: The hyoscines in the bottle looked like tiny lifesavers against nausea.
meanings.sent4: His words were like hyoscines, calming her fears with their soothing effect.
meanings.sent5: The hyoscines acted like a shield, protecting her from the waves of nausea.
